bibl.title: Caesar and the Evil Eye or What to do with ka‹ sÊ, t°knon. <kai su, teknon>
Qui Miscuit Utile Dulci. Festschrift Essays for Paul Lachlan MacKendrick
bibl.author: BRENK, Frederick E.

bibl.note: On the interpretation of the words ascribed to the dying Caesar (SUETONIUS 82, 3; CASSIUS DIO 44, 19, 5) in light of a stele in Cambridge, Fitzwilliam Museum (#E.49.1901), which contains the words ka‹ sÊ. - Non vidimus. Cf. APh 71 (2002) No. 5199. <kai su>
bibl.seg: BRENK Frederick E., Caesar and the Evil Eye or What to do with ka‹ sÊ, t°knon. <kai su, teknon>
Gareth L. SCHMELING and Jon D. MIKALSON (Edd.), Qui Miscuit Utile Dulci. Festschrift Essays for Paul Lachlan MacKendrick (Wauconda, 1998) pp. 31-49.
